Title: Predictive analytics in employee churn: A systematic literature review
Source title: Journal of Management Information and Decision Science
Authors with affiliations: Ekawati, A.D., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The increase of capacity in the collection, storing, and analyzing the massive volume of data due to the rapid advancement of information technology has changed how the decision-makers in organizations approach their work. Human Resource Information Systems provide a lot of data on the employees, but there are still a few best practices on how to make use the abundant data for better decision making in Human Resources area. This limited implementation is mostly due to the decision making process in Human Resources is highly depended on the intuition, the use of advanced data analytics is still in the very early stage of implementation which is left behind in comparison to the use of advanced analytics in other areas such as Marketing, Sales or Finance. This article answers the question on how is the current implementation of predictive analytics in employee churn or employee turnover which is one of the most discussed topics in Human Resources Management, and which method of predictive analytics are better to use in predicting the employee churn. The answers of these questions are obtained from the result of a systematic literature review on the scholarly articles related to the topic published from 2000 to 2018 in major databases such as IEEE, ACM, Science Direct, Emerald and Willey Online. © 2019 Allied Business Academies.
Author Keywords: Big data; Employees churn; Human resource analytics; Intelligent human resource systems; Predictive modeling

Authors: Anggradewi P., Aurelia, Sardjananto S., Ekawati A.D.
Title: Improving quality in service management through critical key performance indicators in maintenance process: A systematic literature review
Affiliations: Industrial Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Anggradewi, P., Industrial Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aurelia, Industrial Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sardjananto, S., Industrial Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ekawati, A.D., Industrial Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Good quality of maintenance process will improve the quality of service management. Key performance indicator (KPI) in the maintenance processes are defined and applied as maintenance process' measurement. The purpose of this research is to define the critical KPI of maintenance process to improve the quality of service management. In this research, a Systematic Literature Review (SLR) is implemented from the previous studies (33 papers) related to the selection of KPI in the maintenance processes. This paper found that the most important KPI in maintenance is Availability that also becomes a leading indicator. Besides availability, there also some of KPI of maintenance such as Mean Time Between Stoppages (MTBS), Mean Time to Repair (MTTR), Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE), Maintainability, Safety, Mean Time Between Failure (MTBF), Reliability, Performance Rate, Quality Rate, Maintenance Time, etc. The popular method to find KPI in maintenance is based on the theories from the existing literature, AHP (Analytical Hierarchy Process), and interview the subject matter expertise in some companies. © 2019, SRAC - Romanian Society for Quality. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Key performance indicator (KPI); Maintenance process; Quality; Service management

Title: Cloud EPR Adoption factors in Large Companies
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ongowarsito, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hendra, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ekawati, A.D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The reason for this examination is to decide the components that impact the acknowledgment and utilization of Cloud ERP by users in big companies. The quantitative method was used in this study with UTAUT 2 model approach. Analysis was carried out on the results of the distributed questionnaire through Google Form to respondents in various big companies using SEM-PLS analysis technique. The outcomes demonstrated that the Habit factor bigly affected the acknowledgment and utilization of Cloud ERP, while Behavioral Intention had a big effect on long-term use by users in big companies in Indonesia. Apart from these factors, it was also found that many users knew and wanted to use Cloud ERP, but there were still a few big companies in Indonesia that adopted the system. Based on all of these, Cloud ERP vendors have a great opportunity to market their products to big companies in Indonesia due to the high level of user interest in the system. In addition, Cloud ERP vendors can pay attention to the Habit and Behavioral Intention factors as priorities in marketing their product. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: big companies; cloud ERP; quantitative; UTA UT 2; vendor
Index Keywords: Commerce; Adoption factors; Behavioral intention; Large companies; quantitative; Quantitative method; User interests; UTA UT 2; vendor; Information management

Authors: Ekawati A.D., Sugandi L., Kusumastuti D.L.
Title: Blended learning in higher education: Does gender influence the student satisfaction on blended learning?
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ekawati, A.D., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sugandi, L., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kusumastuti, D.L., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Blended learning has been implemented in higher education for several years already, but there is still limited study on what actually influence the student satisfaction in a blended learning environment in higher education. An evaluation of blended learning implementation in a university is performed by measuring the satisfaction level of the students in the face-to-face sessions, the independent learning session using online learning, and the overall learning experience with the blended learning environment. Several components have been measured: the content of the online learning, the features, and ease of use of the learning management platform, as well as the interactivity between the students and the lecturer and among the students. This research specifically would like to find out the influence of genders on the satisfaction level of the students that are potentially lead to an improved blended learning design to provide better learning/teaching experience for the students. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Blended learning; Gender; Higher education; Online learning; Student Satisfaction
Index Keywords: Computer aided instruction; E-learning; Information management; Blended learning; Gender; Higher education; Online learning; Student satisfaction; Students
